oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Private M. L. Hunley of Company K

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soldiers; Military personnel; Uniforms; Military uniforms; Helmets; Arms & armament; Rifles; Gas masks; Campaigns & battles; War; World War, 1914-1918; Trench warfare; Military life; Infantry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: "Pvt. M. L. Hunley of Company K, 117th Regiment Infantry, 30th Division and other unidentified soldiers in a trench. Pvt. Hunley appears to be mending a piece of his equipment. The description on the back of the photograph describes him as "caught unaware; s in a battle with second greatest enemy in Europe."
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States. Army. Signal Corps.
